title: Purse, late 17th–early 18th century
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Small and flat envelope-shaped pocket book woven in salmon-colored silk, gold and silver thread and small areas of colored silk. Pattern has a square in the center that frames four fleurs-de-lis in the corners. Surrounding area is patterned with birds, medallions and stylized floral forms.

tombstone.epitaph:
Purse, late 17th–early 18th century.
late 17th–early 18th century. Medium: silk, metal
Technique: woven. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-55-13.
